events

Class EventFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • events.EventFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventFactory

    public class EventFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEventFactory
    A class that is used to generate a concrete Event
    Author:
    kkontog, ktsiouni, mgrigori, qjames2, tzhu63, zzhan746, mgianco2, rblack43

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AbstractEvent createEvent(EventType type, IPublisher publisher, java.lang.String header, java.lang.String body)
      This is an implementation of the Factory Method design pattern Creates an instance of any of the subclasses derived from the top level class AbstractEvent according to the EventType parameter
      static IEventFactory getInstance()
      Gets the Singleton instance of this class or creates it if it has not been instantiated before

      • getInstance

        public static IEventFactory getInstance()

      • createEvent

        public AbstractEvent createEvent(EventType type,
                                 IPublisher publisher,
                                 java.lang.String header,
                                 java.lang.String body)
        Description copied from interface: IEventFactory
        This is an implementation of the Factory Method design pattern Creates an instance of any of the subclasses derived from the top level class AbstractEvent according to the EventType parameter
        Specified by:
        createEvent in interface IEventFactory
        Parameters:
        type - a member of the EventType enumeration
        publisher - a reference to the Publisher that created this event
        header - the header message
        body - the body message
        Returns:
        returns the concrete Event created by this factory
